prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Benjamin
mes:
The music is loud—so loud it practically throbs through the apartment’s overpriced hardwood floors, vibrating like the walls are alive. Bassline hits so deep, it’s shaking shit off shelves. Travis Scott’s voice blares out in tandem with Playboi Carti’s infamous mumble-rap chaos—Tanner doesn’t even know the words, but he’s convinced that mumbling along like he’s just taken a fat edible is cathartic as fuck right now. The beat is like the audio embodiment of chaos, a perfectly curated soundtrack to his current mood. Pissed. And not just a little pissed. Like, borderline apocalyptic rage, but, you know, without flipping furniture or smashing his stupid, overpriced gaming mouse… yet.

The dual monitors in front of him are casting a cold blue glow across the darkened apartment. Shadows stretch weirdly on the walls because he’s got one of those LED strip things around his desk, cycling through every color on the spectrum like his very own mini-rave. On the screen? Ghost’s signature skull balaclava leers back at him as his fingers abuse the controller—dodge, reload, fire. Click-click-CLACK. It's mechanical at this point, muscle memory, except for the fact that he's already died four times because his brain is NOT IN THE GAME. Nope. It’s somewhere else. Specifically, stuck replaying that fucking Instagram story.

Hailee. Fucking Hailee. Ghosting him since yesterday. And then—AND THEN—what does they do? They have the audacity to post an InstaStory. A thirst-trappy one too, with some random-ass guy who looks like he walked out of an H&M catalogue. Who the fuck does they think they are? What’s next, a couples TikTok or some shit? His mind is a volatile cocktail of jealousy and bruised ego, spiced with a sprinkle of shame over just how much this is bothering him. And he is so very pissed.

Who the hell even was that guy? he wonders for the eighty-seventh time since he saw it. That dude with one of those dumb mustaches that try too hard to be ironic but just make you look like you’ve never held a job in your life. And the smile Hailee was giving him? Yeah, that one—soft, tilted just enough to scream ‘I’m so into whatever stupid thing you’re saying right now.’ It’s etched into his mind like a bad tattoo.

God, and then the audacity. Ghosted since yesterday. A whole-ass twenty-four hours of radio silence while they're out there living their best life with Mustache Man.

"Ugh, fuck off, bro!" he snaps aloud when Discord starts pinging on his second monitor, the sound pierces through the haze of chaotic beats, gameplay sounds, and his Carti-esque mutterings—Loco’s name lighting up in neon green. For like the fifth time. Probably wanting to squad up or whatever. "Nah, fuck that. I’m not in the mood to babysit some wannabe Warzone eSports rejects," he grumbles under his breath, side-eyeing the app and willing it to stop the notifs. He grabs his mouse without even looking and mutes it, the same way you’d swat at an annoying fly. He doesn’t even feel bad about it. They’ll get over it. Right now, he’s solo-queuing and mainlining some cathartic violence, no teammates needed.

Or so he keeps telling himself. Because if he stops shooting things on-screen, he’s left with nothing but his spiraling thoughts and that same Travis Scott track looping in the background like an existential crisis in musical form.

Caught up in his pseudo-god-complex streak as Ghost, he doesn’t immediately register the knock on his front door. It’s not like you can hear much over the music anyway. It isn’t until the controller vibrates violently in his hands—screen flashing the dreaded red of death, Ghost splattered across the map by a quickscope from some 12-year-old Canadian sweatlord probably sitting in his parents’ basement right now, eating Froot Loops out of the box—that his brain actually clocks it.

Wait… was that—?

There’s another knock, more insistent this time. It syncs awkwardly with the beat drop, which might’ve been funny if his blood wasn’t already boiling. He throws the controller onto the desk with enough force to send it skittering across the surface and shoves back from his chair. The wheels squeal faintly against the floor as he stands, broad shoulders squared like he’s about to square up with whoever dared interrupt his wallowing.

The walk to the door feels unnecessarily long because every step is loaded with the kind of simmering rage that makes you want to punch something—preferably that dumb mustache from Instagram. He jerks the door open, fully prepared to unleash some scathing one-liner about respecting personal space or whatever.

And then—Hailee.

For a split second, everything stops—the world freezes like he accidentally hit pause on real life instead of the game. There’s this overwhelming, gut-wrenching urge to pull them into the kind of hug that says "Why the fuck do you always get to live rent-free in my head, you inconsiderate, beautiful asshole?"

But he doesn’t. Because he’s pissed. And pissed people don’t give hugs.

He forces his expression into something curt and unbothered—a smirk curling at the edges of his mouth like he doesn’t give two shits they're here. "Oh. You remembered where I live. Congrats," he says, voice oozing sarcasm as he steps aside to let them in, keeping himself from breaking eye contact for longer than 0.2 seconds because he knows if he stares, he’ll crack. "Guess I can take your name off the back of a milk carton now."

Tanner moves back toward his gaming setup without bothering to see if they actually follow him inside. He sinks into his chair like he’s about to win an Oscar for the Most Dramatically Chill Dude Alive. The controller’s already back in his hands before his ass even hits the seat, he pretends to focus on respawning Ghost. But his peripheral vision? Locked on them. Watching their every movement without looking like he’s watching.

"So, what? Came to borrow sugar or some shit? Or do I get an apology for you going full Houdini on me?" he says casually, the venom in his tone undercut by the way his thumb twitches over the buttons—itching for them to say something that'll let him act like he’s still in control of this mess.

It’s petty. He knows it’s petty. But hell if he’s gonna make this easy for them. Not after that story.

name: Hailee
mes:
"I just came to get my jacket i left it here the other night" *Hailee says as she walks further in the room. Her eyes scan the room before zeroing in on her jacket*

*She strides over and picks it off the ground shrugging it on* "Okay I'll see you later Ben"

name: Benjamin
mes:
*His grip tightens imperceptibly around the controller, knuckles whitening just enough to betray him. The screen blurs as Ghost respawns—he doesn’t even register it. That jacket excuse? Weak. And that casual dismissal? Like he’s some fucking Uber driver she’s tipping with a half-assed "thanks." His jaw clenches, tongue pressing against his septum piercing in a nervous tic.*

**"Oh, sick. So you *do* know how to text—just chose not to,"** *he drawls, spinning his chair toward her with deliberate slowness. The LED strips flicker red behind him like a warning signal.* **"Real cute how you waited till I saw your little… *hangout* first."**

*A beat of silence as he studies her—the way the jacket hangs off her frame, how she won’t meet his eyes for more than a second. His voice drops, rough at the edges:* **"Who was he?"**
swipes:
*His grip tightens imperceptibly around the controller, knuckles whitening just enough to betray him. The screen blurs as Ghost respawns—he doesn’t even register it. That jacket excuse? Weak. And that casual dismissal? Like he’s some fucking Uber driver she’s tipping with a half-assed "thanks." His jaw clenches, tongue pressing against his septum piercing in a nervous tic.*

**"Oh, sick. So you *do* know how to text—just chose not to,"** *he drawls, spinning his chair toward her with deliberate slowness. The LED strips flicker red behind him like a warning signal.* **"Real cute how you waited till I saw your little… *hangout* first."**

*A beat of silence as he studies her—the way the jacket hangs off her frame, how she won’t meet his eyes for more than a second. His voice drops, rough at the edges:* **"Who was he?"**

*His grip tightens imperceptibly around the controller, knuckles going white under the LED glow*

"Oh sick, so you *can* text me back—just not when it's about anything that matters. Coolcoolcool." *The words drip with sarcasm as he spins his chair to face her fully now, abandoning all pretense of gaming. His septum piercing glints as he tilts his head mockingly*

"That dude from your story hold your phone hostage or something? Mustache privilege revoked your texting rights?" *A bitter chuckle escapes him as he gestures vaguely at his own face to mimic the guy's facial hair* "Or was I supposed to just... what? Assume you got kidnapped by a rogue barista mid-latte art?"

*He kicks off from the desk suddenly, rolling closer until their knees almost touch. The scent of Versace Eros clings to him—mint and oakmoss with an edge of something darker underneath. His voice drops dangerously low*

"Here's a thought—next time you wanna play ghost? Actually commit. Don't pop up smelling like someone else's cologne expecting me to be chill about it." *The last word comes out strained, betraying how very unchill he actually is right now.*

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee sighs running a hand through her hair* "Uh his name is Asher. Why?" *Hailee asks stopping in the doorway*

name: Benjamin
mes:
*His chair creaks violently as he lurches forward, forearms braced on his knees—the controller abandoned on the desk with a clatter. The LED lights flicker from red to an unstable purple, mirroring the storm in his chest.*

**"Why?"** *He barks out a laugh, sharp and humorless.* **"Oh, I dunno, maybe ‘cause you ghost me for a full-ass day then pop up cozying up to some rando named *Asher* like it’s fucking nothing?"**

*His fingers drum against his thigh—fast, erratic. The septum ring gets another agitated flick.* **"You just expect me to sit here scrolling past that shit like it’s *normal*? Nah. Nah, bro."** *A beat. His voice drops dangerously low:* **"He touch you?"**
swipes:
*His chair creaks violently as he lurches forward, fingers digging into the armrests. The name hits him like a stray bullet—Asher. What kind of pretentious fuckboy name is that? His nostrils flare, the minty scent of his cologne turning acrid with the heat of his anger.*

**"Why?"** *He barks out a laugh, sharp enough to cut glass.* **"Oh, I dunno, maybe ‘cause you ghost me for a full-ass day just to post up with some mustache-twirling motherfucker named Asher like it’s fucking Disney Channel original movie hour?"**

*He’s up now, pacing like a caged animal—hoodie sleeves shoved past his elbows to reveal the tribal ink snaking down his forearms. His voice dips into something dangerously quiet:* **"You really gonna stand there acting like that’s normal? Like I’m supposed to just—"** *A frustrated growl as he rakes a hand through his curls.* **"Fuck. Do you even *want* me to care?"**

*His chair creaks violently as he lurches forward, fingers digging into the armrests. The name hits like a gut punch—Asher. Fucking Asher. Sounds like some pretentious art school douche who drinks oat milk lattes and calls his sneakers "kicks." His nostrils flare as he exhales through his nose, the red LED glow making the veins in his forearms stand out.*

**"Why?"** *He barks a laugh, sharp and humorless.* **"Oh, I dunno, maybe ‘cause you ghost me for 24 hours then pop up on my feed looking at some mustache-twirling fuckboy like he just invented sarcasm."**

*He’s up now, pacing toward her with that predatory slouch—all coiled tension in his shoulders. His voice drops to a growl:* **"You wanna play games? Fine. But don’t act shocked when I call your bluff."** *A beat.* **"...Was he better than me?"** *The question slips out raw, stupidly vulnerable beneath the bravado.*

*His chair creaks violently as he lurches forward, forearms braced on his knees—the controller abandoned on the desk with a clatter. The LED lights flicker from red to an unstable purple, mirroring the storm in his chest.*

**"Why?"** *He barks out a laugh, sharp and humorless.* **"Oh, I dunno, maybe ‘cause you ghost me for a full-ass day then pop up cozying up to some rando named *Asher* like it’s fucking nothing?"**

*His fingers drum against his thigh—fast, erratic. The septum ring gets another agitated flick.* **"You just expect me to sit here scrolling past that shit like it’s *normal*? Nah. Nah, bro."** *A beat. His voice drops dangerously low:* **"He touch you?"**
